quick_start.title: Quick Start — How to Use the PPF Calculator

Enter the tenure (default 15 years; you can extend).
Interest rate: auto-filled with the current government PPF rate — you can override it.
Click Calculate to see: maturity amount, total invested, interest earned, and year-wise table.

example.title: Example — PPF Maturity Calculation (Step-by-step)
example.scenario: Scenario: You invest ₹1,50,000 per year for 15 years at 7.1% interest.

rules.title: PPF Rules — What Every Investor Should Know
points: Lock-in: 15 years (extendable in blocks of 5 years).
Partial withdrawals: Allowed from the 7th financial year under specific rules.
Loan facility: Available from the 3rd year.
Tax treatment: Contributions up to ₹1.5 lakh qualify under Section 80C and interest + maturity are tax-free (EEE).

comparison.title: PPF vs FD vs NPS — Quick Comparison

faqs.question: What is the current PPF interest rate?
faqs.answer: The PPF rate changes quarterly. The calculator auto-fills the current rate; you can override it.

faqs.question: Can I deposit monthly or yearly?
faqs.answer: Yes. PPF accepts monthly or annual deposits — both are supported by this calculator.

faqs.question: When does a deposit start earning interest?
faqs.answer: Deposits made before the 5th of a month earn interest for that month. This detail is highlighted on several top calculators.

faqs.question: Can I withdraw before 15 years?
faqs.answer: Partial withdrawal rules apply from the seventh financial year; full withdrawal normally after maturity (15 years).
